metadata.title: CVE-2021-45485 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the IPv6 implementation in the Linux kernel before 5.13.3,net/ipv6/output_core.c has an information leak because of certain use of ahash table which, although big, doesn't properly consider that IPv6-basedattackers can typically choose among many IPv6 source addresses.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-45485` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-219-generic - 4.4.0-219.252
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-219-generic - 4.4.0-219.252
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-219-lowlatency - 4.4.0-219.252
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-156-generic - 4.15.0-156.163~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-156-generic - 4.15.0-156.163~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-156-lowlatency - 4.15.0-156.163~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1100-kvm - 4.4.0-1100.109
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1135-aws - 4.4.0-1135.149
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1111-aws - 4.15.0-1111.118~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1123-azure - 4.15.0-1123.136~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1108-gcp - 4.15.0-1108.122~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1080-oracle - 4.15.0-1080.88~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-219.252').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-156.163~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1100.109').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1135.149').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1111.118~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1123.136~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1108.122~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1080.88~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
